item.title: [help service for free] u making your own private server?
item.dc:creator: @im_cool im cool
item.description:
@im_cool wrote:

my compile for testscape says ‘javac’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . . and i dont know what to do
and when i click edit this is what it says

@echo off
COLOR 08
title Testscape Server
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.Java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0\bin/javac.exe” server
pause

do i need to change that cause i didnt understand what u said to lob can u explain it a little better?

Read full topic

item.title: [help service for free] u making your own private server?
item.dc:creator: @badly4sniffy badly4sniffy
item.description:
@badly4sniffy wrote:

lobospirit this is easy to fix

just search for javac error and than u find a tut at this website![br][size=1]Posted at: August 06, 2006, 05:40:10 AM[/size][hr][quote=“badly4sniffy”]lobospirit this is easy to fix

just search for javac error and than u find a tut at this website![/quote]

  1. downloaded newest java
    http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/download.jsp (get the one without netbeans but with jdk 1.5)
  2. set CLASSPATH
  3. right click my computer and click properties
  4. click advanced
    3.click Enviorment Variables
  5. click NEW
  6. variable name “CLASSPATH”
  7. variable value “SET CLASSPATH=C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06in;%CLASSPATH%;.”
    ^ do not add the quotes (these things “”)
  8. look at the file thats causing the error by right clicking and clicking edit if it has a directory too javac take it out and just have javac *java
    theres what you need! (misssilabsofts tut)

Read full topic
